result.execSummary:
The defendant Tessa Jean Mielke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tessa Jean Mielke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tessa Jean Mielke was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Tessa Jean Mielke was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Tessa Jean Mielke, defendant does not appear in Court. State appears by Craig Nolen. Defendant has not appeared at last case, warrant was issued and bond forfeiture hearing scheduled. Based on non appearance, state requests judgment be entered against the defendant for the $2000. Notice was mailed to defendant 08-25-17, Return of mail 09-21-17. State looks up statutes, notice was sent to last known address. State believes court should grant judgment. Court grants judgment in favor of Green County. On reviewing case, no record of signature bond signed. Court vacates judgment, Matter set over, notice to be resent to last known address. November 3, 2:15
